call_title: Bene | Bruno Woltzenlogel Paleo & Jossemii | ErgoHack 9

topics.title: Beene Platform Introduction and Core Mechanics
topics.summary: Bruno introduces Beene, a proof of funding platform that enables projects to raise funds while rewarding contributors with tokens. He explains the core mechanics including funding vaults, minimum amounts, deadlines, and the distribution of proof of funding tokens to contributors.

topics.title: Platform Rules and Visual Framework
topics.summary: Bruno presents a graphical representation of the platform rules showing how project owners and contributors can interact based on time and funding thresholds. The chart illustrates when withdrawals and refunds are possible.

topics.title: Stable Order SDK Funding Example
topics.summary: Bruno provides a real-world example of using the platform for Stable Order's SDK development, requiring 5000 ERG to develop an SDK for Gluon Gold. He contrasts this with their previous manual process using Ergo Raffle.

topics.title: Ergo Articles Production Funding Scenario
topics.summary: Bruno demonstrates a flexible funding scenario where community members can produce 5-20 articles about Ergo at 100 ERG per article. The example shows how the project can scale from minimum to maximum goals and even expand further based on success.

topics.title: Scam Protection and Refund Mechanism
topics.summary: Bruno illustrates how the platform protects contributors from scams through a hypothetical example of a fraudulent project promising amazing results. Contributors can safely retrieve their funds after the deadline if minimum goals aren't met.

topics.title: Platform Use Cases and Applications
topics.summary: Bruno outlines various use cases for the platform including donations, crowdfunding, startup funding, event tickets, and benefactions. He emphasizes the platform's versatility and mentions Stable Order's collaborative contribution model.

topics.title: Beene Platform Demo Walkthrough
topics.summary: Jossemii demonstrates the Beene platform interface, showing project listings, contribution pages, and the process of creating new projects and making contributions. The demo includes minting tokens, setting project parameters, and executing transactions.
